text: Hungary competed at the 1896 Summer Olympics in Athens, Greece. Austrian and Hungarian results at early Olympic Games are generally kept separate despite the union of the two nations as Austria-Hungary at the time. Seven athletes from Hungary competed in six sports. The Hungarian medals came on 18 entries in 15 events. __TOC__ ==Medalists== | width=78% align=left valign=top | {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:95%" |- !Medal !Name !Sport !Event !Date |- | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2| | rowspan=2|Swimming | Men's 100 m freestyle | |- | Men's 1200 m freestyle | |- | | || Athletics | Men's 800 m | |- | | || Athletics | Men's 100 m | |- | | || Athletics | Men's marathon | |- | | || Tennis | Men's singles | |} Default sort order: Medal, Date, Name | width=22% align=left valign=top | {| class=wikitable style="font-size:85%; float:right" |- bgcolor=efefef !colspan=7|Medals by sport |- style="text- align:center" |Sport | bgcolor=#f7f6a8 |Image:Gold medal icon.svg | bgcolor=#dce5e5 |Image:Silver medal icon.svg | bgcolor=#ffdab9 |Image:Bronze medal icon.svg |Total |- style="text-align:center" |Swimming | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |2 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |2 |- style="text-align:center" |Athletics | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |1 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |2 |3 |- style="text-align:center" |Tennis | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |1 |1 |- style="text-align:center" ! Total || 7 || 0 || 7 |} | width=22% align=left valign=top | {| class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- bgcolor=efefef !colspan=7|Medals by date |- style="text-align:center" |Day |Date | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |Image:Gold medal icon.svg | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |Image:Silver medal icon.svg | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |Image:Bronze medal icon.svg |Total |- style="text-align:center" |Day 1 |6 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |1 |1 |- style="text-align:center" |Day 2 |7 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |0 |- style="text-align:center" |Day 3 |8 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |0 |- style="text- align:center" |Day 4 |9 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |1 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |1 |- style="text-align:center" |Day 5 |10 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |1 |1 |- style="text- align:center" |Day 6 |11 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |2 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |1 | 3 |- style="text-align:center" |Day 7 |12 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |0 |- style="text- align:center" |Day 8 |13 April | bgcolor=F7F6A8 |0 | bgcolor=DCE5E5 |0 | bgcolor=FFDAB9 |0 |0 |- !colspan=2|Total ! style="background:gold" |2 ! style="background:silver" |1 ! style="background:#c96" |3 !6 |} ==Athletics== Hungarian athletic team of 1896 Summer Olympics Nándor Dáni Alajos Szokolyi The Hungarian athletes were successful in each event except the 110 metre hurdles, taking a silver, two bronzes, and a 4th-place finish. The entry and competitor lists for some events are not agreed on by all sources. In the 100 metres, Dáni, Leonidasz Manno, and István Zachar may have entered and not started (or possibly have competed) along with Szokolyi.Butler, Maynard. The Olympic Games. In Mallon & Widlund, pp. 37–41.Ekkehard zur Megede : The history of Olympic athletics. Volume 1: 1896-1936. text-align:center" |- !Athlete !Event !Rank |- |rowspan=4 align=left|Gyula Kakas |align=left|Horizontal bar |unranked |- |align=left|Parallel bars |unranked |- |align=left|Pommel horse |unranked |- |align=left|Vault |unranked |- |rowspan=4 align=left|Dezső Wein |align=left|Horizontal bar |unranked |- |align=left|Parallel bars |unranked |- |align=left|Rings |unranked |- |align=left|Vault |unranked |} ==Swimming== Alfréd Hajós Hajós won both events he entered, taking two of the four swimming medals (he could not enter the 100 metres for sailors event, and the 500 metres was immediately after the 100 metres and immediately before the 1200 metres). ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%; text-align:center" |- !rowspan=2|Athlete !rowspan=2|Event !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank |- |rowspan=2 align=left|Alfréd Hajós |align=left|100 metre freestyle |1:22.2 | |- |align=left|1200 metre freestyle |18:22.2 | |} ==Tennis== Tapavicza was defeated by Dionysios Kasdaglis in the semifinals of the singles tournament. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%; text- align:center" |- !rowspan=2|Athlete !rowspan=2|Event !Round of 16 !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Opposition Score !Opposition Score !Opposition Score !Opposition Score !Rank |- |align=left|Momcsilló Tapavicza |align=left|Men's singles | W | | L |Did not advance | |} ==Weightlifting== Tapavicza took last place in the weightlifting competition. The amount he lifted is unknown except that it was less than 90 kilograms, the amount lifted by the third through fifth place contestants. {| class=wikitable style="font-size:90%; text-align:center" |- !Athlete !Event !Result !Rank |- |align=left|Momcsilló Tapavicza |align=left|Men's two hand lift |unknown |6 |} ==Wrestling== Tapavicza lost his only wrestling match, which turned into a contest of endurance. {|class=wikitable border=1 style="font-size:90%; text-align:center" !rowspan=2|Athlete !rowspan=2|Event !Quarterfinal !Semifinal !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size: 95%" !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Rank |- |align=left|Momcsilló Tapavicza |align=left|Men's Greco-Roman | L |colspan=2|Did not advance |4 |} ==Notes== ==References== * (Digitally available at ) * (Excerpt available at ) * Category:Nations at the 1896 Summer Olympics 1896 Olympics
